headline: Immersion Stock Surges as It Monetizes Haptic Technology Patents
summary: Immersion Corp. (NASDAQ: IMMR), a pioneer in haptic technology, saw its stock surge after it settled a patent lawsuit with Meta Platforms Inc. for $87.5 million and secured a licensing agreement. The company specializes in licensing its extensive patent portfolio for haptic feedback used in billions of devices and has also made a significant investment in Barnes and Noble Education Inc. Immersion continues to evolve its active sensing technology and monetize its intellectual property.

headline: 3 Dividend-Growth Stocks That a Top-Rated Vanguard Fund Manager Likes
summary: This article highlights three dividend-growth stocks favored by Peter Fisher, lead manager of the Vanguard Dividend Growth fund (VDIGX), which holds Morningstar’s Gold Medalist Rating. These stocks are Microsoft (MSFT), Stryker (SYK), and Apple (AAPL), chosen for their strong operating performance and ability to grow dividends annually by more than 8%. The fund manager and Morningstar analysts provide an in-depth look at each company's financial health, economic moats, and stock valuations.

headline: Landsea Homes sells out at 55+ community at Verrado in Buckeye
summary: Landsea Homes Corporation has announced a complete sell-out of its 86 homes at the Skye Ridge at Victory 55+ active adult community in Buckeye, Arizona. Following this success, the company is preparing to launch Mira Vista at Victory this fall, offering 145 new duplex and single-family home floorplans with anticipated prices starting in the upper-$300ks. These new homes will also feature Landsea Homes’ High Performance Home features within the Verrado master-planned community.

headline: Berkshire Just Crossed $1 Trillion. Is It a Buy?
summary: Berkshire Hathaway recently reached a market capitalization of $1 trillion, joining an exclusive group of U.S. firms. Despite its significant rally this year, Morningstar analysts currently rate Berkshire Hathaway stock as moderately overvalued, with a 2-star rating. The article details the company's strong Q2 earnings, insurance operations, rising cash pile, and continued equity selling, while also addressing risks such as CEO longevity and competitive markets.

headline: MSA Safety Honored with Outstanding Innovator Award
summary: MSA Safety (NYSE: MSA) has been honored with the 2024 Outstanding Corporate Innovator (OCI) Award by The Product Development and Management Association (PDMA) for the second time. The company was recognized for its commitment to innovation, customer-centric focus, and transformation into a global leader in advanced safety technologies, particularly for integrating Voice-of-Customer feedback into its innovation strategy. MSA Safety will accept the award at the 2024 PDMA Inspire Innovation Conference in St. Louis on September 16, 2024.

headline: Apple fends off appeal of win in $506 mln University of Wisconsin patent case
summary: A U.S. appeals court rejected the University of Wisconsin's bid for a new trial in its long-running patent dispute with Apple regarding computer processor technology. This decision upholds a 2022 ruling that denied a new trial to the university, which had previously won a $506 million verdict that was later overturned. The court found that the university should have presented its infringement theory during the original trial.

headline: This type of index fund might help you after the S&P 500’s concentration peaks
summary: The S&P 500's concentration in a few large-cap technology stocks is nearing peak levels, with 19.6% of the SPDR S&P 500 ETF Trust concentrated in Apple, Microsoft, and Nvidia as of August 30. This high concentration runs counter to the diversification often sought by index fund investors, as a decade ago the top three holdings made up only 7.9% of the fund. The article suggests that while S&P 500 index funds have been beneficial, the current concentration might prompt investors to consider alternatives for broader risk management.

headline: A Dot-Com-Like Bust Isn’t in the Cards for AI Investors Who Diversify
summary: Concerns about an AI bubble akin to the dot-com bust are overblown, according to J.P. Morgan Private Bank, citing lower valuations and stronger earnings expectations for current AI leaders. While investing in an S&P 500 index fund provides some AI exposure, investors seeking outperformance should diversify across AI infrastructure (AI 1.0) and AI applications (AI 2.0), potentially including global companies and low-cost ETFs for broader exposure. A long-term perspective is crucial as AI is expected to be a multi-year or multi-decade trend.

headline: How Nvidia doubled earnings, lost almost $300 billion in value and shook the stock market
summary: Nvidia experienced a significant stock market shake-up, losing almost $300 billion in value in a single day, despite having doubled its earnings. This downturn is attributed to growing fears of an economic slowdown and renewed skepticism about the immediate payoff from AI investments, causing broader market indexes to also fall. Analysts highlight Nvidia's dependence on continued massive AI investments from major tech companies and warn of stock volatility.

headline: Target integrates curbside and in-store order pickup services with Apple CarPlay
summary: Target is the first retailer to integrate its curbside and in-store order pickup services with Apple CarPlay, allowing customers to manage their Drive Up and pickup orders directly from their car's built-in screens. This new feature enables shoppers to view order details, get directions, and notify the store of their arrival, streamlining the pickup process. Target plans to introduce a similar service for Android Auto soon, enhancing convenience for its customers.

headline: Global Sustainable Funds Are Up Nearly 11% This Year
summary: Global large-cap sustainable funds have seen an average return of 10.9% year-to-date, slightly lagging broader market indices. The top-performing sustainable funds, however, have achieved significantly higher returns, largely driven by investments in companies like Nvidia and Constellation Energy. This article details the largest and best-performing global large-cap sustainable funds, highlighting their strategies and key holdings.

headline: 4 charts on the US rotation out of growth and tech stocks
summary: The article discusses the recent rotation in the US stock market, with investors shifting away from high-flying growth and tech stocks, particularly those tied to AI, towards value stocks in sectors like financials, healthcare, and consumer defensive. This shift is attributed to overvaluation in AI plays and attractive valuations in value and small-cap stocks, with economists foreseeing rate cuts and a soft landing. While major tech companies that led the market rally are now seeing declines, value stocks and defensive sectors are supporting the market's overall performance.

headline: Apple’s new CFO appointed: Indian origin Kevan Parekh will succeed Luca M
summary: Apple Inc. has named Kevan Parekh as its next CFO, succeeding Luca Maestri, effective January 1, 2025. Parekh, of Indian origin, currently serves as Apple's Vice-President for Financial Planning and Analysis (FP&A) and has been with the company since 2013, playing a key role in its financial and business planning. This transition is part of Apple's long-term leadership strategy as Maestri moves into a new role within Apple's Corporate Services teams.

headline: Apple introduces iPhone 16 and iPhone 16 Plus
summary: Apple announced the iPhone 16 and iPhone 16 Plus, featuring the new A18 chip and built for Apple Intelligence, an easy-to-use personal intelligence system. The new models boast powerful camera upgrades, including a 48MP Fusion camera with 2x Telephoto option, Camera Control for enhanced visual interaction, and improved battery life. Pre-orders begin September 13, with availability starting September 20.

headline: LiveOne to raise prices of its Plus, Premium subscription audio tiers
summary: LiveOne is increasing the prices of its Plus and Premium streaming music subscriptions to cover costs associated with new features and innovations, including leveraging artificial intelligence. The annual cost of LiveOne Plus will rise to $40 per year, and LiveOne Premium will increase to $11 per month, aligning with competitors like Spotify and Apple Music. CEO Robert Ellin believes AI will significantly improve user experience and help the company reach 10 million subscribers and $1 billion in revenue within five years.

headline: VIDEO: ETF of the Week: ALPS Equal Sector Weight ETF (EQL)
summary: This article features a discussion between Todd Rosenbluth, Head of Research at VettaFi, and Chuck Jaffe of "Money Life" about the ALPS Equal Sector Weight ETF (EQL). They explore how EQL equal-weights sectors rather than individual stocks, providing a different approach to diversification compared to market-cap-weighted indices. The conversation also covers EQL's historical performance and how it can complement an existing portfolio by reducing concentration risk in mega-cap stocks and specific sectors.

headline: Key Apple supplier Jabil to set up electronics manufacturing unit in Trichy
summary: Jabil, a key supplier for Apple Inc., is establishing a new electronics manufacturing unit in Trichy, Tamil Nadu. This move further solidifies Tamil Nadu's position as a hub for Apple suppliers, joining other major players like Foxconn, Pegatron, Tata Electronics, and Salcomp. The expansion highlights the increasing investment in electronics manufacturing within the region.

headline: Apple supplier Jabil to set up Rs 2,000 crore mfg unit in Tiruchirapalli
summary: Apple supplier Jabil Inc. is investing Rs 2,000 crore to establish an electronics manufacturing facility in Tiruchirappalli, India, creating 5,000 jobs. This move signifies the expanding Apple supplier ecosystem in India, with Tamil Nadu emerging as a prominent electronics manufacturing hub. The investment is part of India's "China Plus One" strategy, drawing global players to diversify their manufacturing bases.

headline: Apple's supplier Jabil to invest ₹2,000 cr in Tamil Nadu, aims to create 5,000 jobs
summary: Apple's contract manufacturer Jabil Inc. is set to invest ₹2,000 crore in a new electronics manufacturing facility in Tiruchirapalli, Tamil Nadu, expecting to create 5,000 jobs. This makes Jabil the fourth Apple supplier in the state, joining Foxconn, Pegatron, and Tata Electronics, and was finalized during Tamil Nadu CM M.K. Stalin's U.S. visit. The investment contributes to Tamil Nadu's growing electronics exports, largely driven by iPhone shipments, positioning the state as India's electronics hub.

headline: Jabil Inc to invest ₹2,000 crore in electronics manufacturing unit in Tiruchi in Tamil Nadu
summary: Jabil Inc. and Rockwell Automation are set to invest a total of ₹2,666 crore in industrial projects in Tamil Nadu. Jabil Inc. will invest ₹2,000 crore in an electronics manufacturing unit in Tiruchi, creating 5,000 jobs, while Rockwell Automation will expand its unit in Kancheepuram with an investment of ₹666 crore. These investments were formalized through MoUs signed in the presence of Tamil Nadu Chief Minister M.K. Stalin in Chicago.

headline: JABIL to invest ₹2,000 crore in electronics manufacturing facility at Manapparai, create 5,000 Jobs
summary: JABIL, a $35 billion global manufacturing company, will invest ₹2,000 crore to establish an electronics manufacturing facility in Manapparai, Tamil Nadu, creating over 5,000 jobs. This investment, formalized through an MoU exchanged in the US, marks the emergence of Tamil Nadu's third major electronics cluster in Trichy and is expected to significantly boost the central zone's economy. Additionally, Rockwell Automation is expanding its manufacturing with a ₹666 crore investment in Kanchipuram, and an MoU was signed with Autodesk for skill development.

headline: T. Rowe Price Tapping Into Experienced Managers
summary: T. Rowe Price is successfully bringing experienced mutual fund managers into the ETF industry, leveraging their active management skills. The firm has launched several active ETFs, some replicating successful mutual funds and others managed by seasoned teams. This strategy has led to significant asset growth in their ETF offerings, appealing to advisors.

headline: Ireland’s special relationship with Apple and Google has created a multibillion-dollar windfall—and an existential crisis
summary: Ireland recently received a €13 billion tax windfall from Apple, resulting from an EU ruling on unpaid taxes, which significantly adds to its already substantial government surplus. While seemingly positive, this windfall presents an economic dilemma as Ireland struggles with how to spend the funds and questions its long-standing relationship with U.S. tech giants amidst existing infrastructure and housing crises. The country faces pressure to invest in improvements to maintain its attractiveness as a business hub, despite concerns about overheating the economy or securing funds for future needs.

headline: Jabil Inc to invest Rs 2,000 crore in Trichy
summary: Jabil Inc, a key supplier to Apple and others, is set to invest Rs 2,000 crore in Trichy, Tamil Nadu. This significant investment is expected to create 5,000 jobs and foster a new electronics manufacturing cluster in the region, as announced by Tamil Nadu Chief Minister M.K. Stalin.

headline: Jabil Inc to pour Rs 2,000 Crore into new electronics manufacturing plant in Tiruchi
summary: Jabil Inc is committing Rs 2,000 crore to establish a new electronics manufacturing facility in Tiruchi, Tamil Nadu, a strategic investment expected to create approximately 5,000 jobs. This move is part of broader industrial development efforts in the region, with Jabil Inc. and Rockwell Automation collectively investing Rs 2,666 crore. The expansion reinforces Tamil Nadu's growing prominence as an electronics manufacturing hub.

headline: Top EU court rules Apple owes Ireland over $14B in back taxes
source: International Consortium of Investigative Journalists - ICIJ
summary: The European Union Court of Justice has ruled that Apple must pay over 13 billion euros (more than $14 billion) in back taxes to Ireland, concluding a years-long legal battle. This decision overturned a 2020 ruling and supports the European Commission's claim that special tax rates offered to Apple constituted unlawful state aid. The ruling stems from the 2017 Paradise Papers investigation, which revealed how Apple restructured its Irish companies to gain significant tax advantages.

headline: ResMed lauds Apple’s sleep apnoea detection feature
summary: ResMed (NYSE:RMD) has expressed strong support for Apple's new sleep apnea detection feature integrated into its latest smartwatches, believing it will significantly increase awareness and early diagnosis of the disorder. ResMed highlights the widespread and often undiagnosed nature of sleep apnea, which affects nearly 2.5 billion people, and sees Apple's involvement as a collaborative step toward improving global health outcomes. Both companies emphasize the critical role of sleep in overall health and the potential of technology to identify serious medical conditions.

headline: iOS 18 is available today, making iPhone more personal and capable than ever
summary: Apple has released iOS 18, bringing significant updates to iPhone customization, the Photos app, Messages, Mail, and introducing Apple Intelligence. Users can now personalize their Home Screen and Control Center, enjoy a redesigned Photos experience with automatic organization, and benefit from enhanced communication features. Apple Intelligence, rolling out next month, integrates generative models with personal context for advanced features in writing, photo editing, and Siri, all while prioritizing user privacy.

headline: Apple ships $6 billion of iPhones from India in big China shift
summary: Apple's iPhone exports from India increased by a third to nearly $6 billion in the six months ending September, signaling a significant shift from China. This expansion is driven by Indian subsidies and a skilled workforce, with the company on track to surpass $10 billion in annual exports for fiscal year 2024. Despite its growth in India, Apple still relies heavily on China for manufacturing and sales, though its Indian revenue hit a record $8 billion due to new stores and increased demand.

headline: Politan prevails in Masimo proxy fight, gaining 2 board seats and ousting CEO Joe Kiani
summary: Activist investor Politan Capital Management secured two new board seats at Masimo's annual meeting, leading to the ouster of founder and CEO Joe Kiani and fellow board member Chris Chavez. This victory doubles Politan's previous board representation and follows criticism over Masimo's acquisition of Sound United and its plans to spin out consumer businesses. Following the vote, Masimo's stock price saw a 3.4% increase.

headline: Is the iShares Russell 1000 Growth ETF a Millionaire Maker?
summary: This article discusses the iShares Russell 1000 Growth ETF (IWF) as a potential "millionaire maker" investment. It highlights the ETF's historical performance, its focus on growth stocks within the Russell 1000 index, and its exposure to both large and mid-cap companies. The author suggests that while not perfectly balanced, IWF offers a good chance to outperform the broader market over the long term.

headline: Should Motley Fool 100 Index ETF (TMFC) Be on Your Investing Radar?
summary: The Motley Fool 100 Index ETF (TMFC) is highlighted as a suitable option for investors seeking exposure to the Large Cap Growth segment of the US equity market, especially given its strong performance and Zacks ETF Rank of 2 (Buy). The article details its expense ratio, sector allocation, top holdings like Apple, Microsoft, and Nvidia, and compares it to alternative ETFs such as Vanguard Growth ETF (VUG) and Invesco QQQ (QQQ). Investors are encouraged to consider TMFC's attributes alongside its risk and performance metrics for long-term investment strategies.

headline: Artificial Intelligence and Adaptive Portfolio Management
summary: This article highlights a podcast episode from Investor Insights that explores the role of Artificial Intelligence in adaptive portfolio management. The discussion emphasizes AI as a tool to enhance human expertise in creating sophisticated investment applications and evolving portfolio strategies from traditional "buy and hold" approaches. It concludes that investors need to understand AI's implications for portfolio management, even if they don't grasp its technical intricacies.

headline: Hello Group: Undervalued With Expertise In App Development Makes It Attractive
summary: Hello Group (MOMO) is considered significantly undervalued with a P/E ratio of 5x TTM Non-GAAP earnings and 2x TTM EBITDA, presenting a strong buy opportunity. The company benefits from its app development expertise, presence in China's market, and a recently upsized stock repurchase program. However, risks include its Cayman Islands incorporation, operational challenges in China, and potential regulatory changes.

headline: Apple unexpectedly fell on rebalancing day, who is the culprit?
summary: Apple experienced a surprising downturn on a rebalancing day when it was expected to benefit from index adjustments. Despite anticipation of increased buying pressure from index funds, a massive sell-off of 30 million shares occurred in the final minutes of trading. Theories suggest either active funds capitalizing on predictable liquidity or arbitrageurs selling after accumulating shares before the rebalancing event contributed to the unexpected drop.

headline: Apple’s Lisa Jackson on How to Design for Sustainability
summary: Lisa Jackson, Apple's VP of environment, policy, and social initiatives, advises entrepreneurs on designing for sustainability by involving affected communities and embracing regulation. Drawing from her EPA experience, she highlights how regulation "levels the playing field" for businesses committed to environmental responsibility and encourages young people to pursue careers in sustainability, stressing the importance of scientific understanding.

headline: InterDigital, IBD Stock Of The Day, Flirts With Buy Point After Analyst Day
summary: InterDigital (IDCC) has been named IBD Stock Of The Day and is approaching a buy point of 140.60 after an analyst day. The stock has a Composite Rating of 95/99 and is forming a shallow flat base. The article also mentions widespread investment in AI stocks by major tech companies.

headline: Guo Mingxi: Meta AR glasses Orion will be mass-produced as early as 2027, positioning to replace mobile phones and computers.
summary: Analyst Ming-Chi Kuo from TF International Securities predicts that Meta's AR glasses, Orion, could enter mass production as early as 2027, aiming to replace smartphones and tablets. Orion's key selling points are its integration of AI technology and spatial computing, though technical challenges and production partner decisions could delay the timeline. Meta may release a lower-spec version before the full-scale mass production to gather market feedback.

headline: Ingram Micro IPO, Revenue Details Go Live
summary: Ingram Micro has filed its registration statement with the SEC for a proposed initial public offering, with its common stock set to trade under the symbol "INGM" on the New York Stock Exchange. The filing reveals that Ingram Micro's net sales have declined over the past three years, from $54.4 billion in 2021 to $48 billion in 2023. Platinum Equity, which owns Ingram, will sell the common stock through its entity Imola JV Holdings, with the number of available shares and price range yet to be determined.

headline: Goldman Sachs Reiterates Buy Rating on Jabil (JBL)
summary: Goldman Sachs has reiterated a Buy rating on Jabil (NYSE: JBL) with a $136.00 price target, following the company's Q4 FY24 earnings report. Despite a mixed report with FY25 EBIT guidance modestly below the Street, Goldman Sachs believes Jabil's repositioned business mix, focusing on favorable end markets like datacenter, auto, industrial, renewables, and medical, will drive long-term growth. The firm also notes Jabil's investments in these areas, addition of new hyperscale customers, and supportive capital allocation as reasons to maintain a positive outlook.

headline: ResMed Unveils New Collection of Digital and Personalized Solutions designed to Improve Sleep Health
summary: ResMed has announced new patient-centric products aimed at enhancing the therapy journey for sleep apnea patients, integrating with digital wearables and generative AI for a more personalized sleep health experience. Key innovations include a myAir™ smartwatch app, sleep staging integration, personalized coaching, holistic health trend tracking, and an AI-enabled sleep health concierge named Dawn. Additionally, ResMed introduced LUXE travel gear designed for CPAP users on the go.

headline: EPAM Completes Acquisition of NEORIS
summary: EPAM Systems, Inc. announced the successful completion of its acquisition of NEORIS, a global advanced technology consultancy. This acquisition enhances EPAM’s delivery capabilities in Latin America and Europe, significantly boosting client value across key industries. It also strategically expands EPAM's offerings to Spanish- and Portuguese-speaking countries and broadens global nearshore delivery capabilities.

headline: Barclays Sticks to Its Buy Rating for Anheuser Busch InBev SA/NV (0RJI)
summary: Barclays has reiterated its Buy rating for Anheuser Busch InBev SA/NV (0RJI), setting a price target of €88.00. J.P. Morgan also maintained a Buy rating with a €75.00 price target. The company currently has a "Strong Buy" analyst consensus with a price target consensus of €68.86, indicating a 30.99% upside.

headline: MDU Resources Completes Spinoff of Everus Construction Group
summary: MDU Resources Group, Inc. has successfully completed the spinoff of its construction services subsidiary, Everus Construction Group, making Everus an independent public company. MDU Resources shareholders received one share of Everus common stock for every four shares of MDU Resources common stock held, with Everus now trading on the NYSE under the ticker symbol "ECG." This strategic move aims to create value for shareholders and position MDU Resources as a pure-play regulated energy delivery business.

headline: ETF trading: Silver ETFs Outperform GLD Amid Strong Metals Rally
summary: Silver ETFs, specifically Abrdn Physical Silver Shares ETF (SIVR) and iShares Silver Trust (SLV), have surged nearly 41% year-to-date, outperforming the SPDR Gold Trust ETF (GLD) which rose 33%. This performance for silver is its best since 2020, driven by factors similar to gold, increased industrial demand, and anticipated interest rate cuts. Despite its volatility, silver is seen by some analysts as having significant upside potential, possibly testing its 2011 peak.

headline: Truist adds JPMorgan exec to lead mid-corporate unit
summary: Truist Financial has hired Kerry Jessani, a former JPMorgan executive, to lead its mid-corporate banking unit starting in February. Jessani brings over 20 years of experience from JPMorgan, where she most recently served as deputy head of specialized industries for commercial banking. This strategic hire aims to enhance Truist's commercial banking business and complement its investment corporate banking coverage.

headline: Equitable hones in on annuity delivery across channels after strong Q3
summary: Equitable Holdings is focusing on its strong annuity products, particularly its market-leading registered indexed-linked annuities (RILAs), after a strong Q3. Despite increasing competition in the RILA market, Equitable believes its integrated business model and partnerships, such as those with J.P. Morgan Asset Management and BlackRock for lifetime income solutions, will continue to drive growth. The company reported record assets under management and administration of $1 trillion, despite a net income decrease compared to the previous year.

headline: JP Morgan AM brings $37bn US equity premium income ETF to Europe
summary: JP Morgan Asset Management (JPMAM) has launched two new active premium income ETFs in Europe: the JPMorgan US Equity Premium Income Active UCITS ETF (JEPI) and the JPMorgan Nasdaq Equity Premium Income Active UCITS ETF (JEPQ). These UCITS versions mirror successful US-listed strategies, with the US JEPI having amassed $36.6bn and JEPQ $17.6bn. Both new ETFs are designed to provide high yields and reduced volatility through an options strategy.

headline: DevvStream Holdings Inc. Announces Completion of Business Combination with Focus Impact Acquisition Corp.; Secures Up to US$43M of Additional Capital to Execute Growth Plans
summary: DevvStream Holdings Inc. has completed its business combination with Focus Impact Acquisition Corp., making it the first publicly traded carbon credit generation company on a major U.S. stock exchange. The combined entity will be renamed DevvStream Corp. and its shares are expected to trade on the Nasdaq under the ticker "DEVS" starting November 7, 2024. DevvStream also secured up to $43 million in additional financing to accelerate growth and democratize access to carbon markets.

headline: Wells Fargo Bank Decreases Prime Rate to 7.75 Percent
summary: Wells Fargo Bank announced it is decreasing its prime rate to 7.75 percent from 8.00 percent, effective November 8, 2024. The company, a leading financial services provider with approximately $1.9 trillion in assets, offers a diversified set of banking, investment, and mortgage products. Wells Fargo focuses its social impact on building a sustainable, inclusive future by supporting housing affordability, small business growth, financial health, and a low-carbon economy.

headline: Enstar shareholders approve acquisition by Sixth Street
summary: Enstar Group Limited shareholders have approved its acquisition by Sixth Street in a $5.1 billion transaction. Upon closing, expected in mid-2025, Enstar will become a privately-held company and its shareholders will receive $338.00 in cash per ordinary share. The company will continue to operate under its current name and business strategy.

headline: Why Shares of QuantumScape, First Solar, and ChargePoint Plunged in October
summary: Shares of QuantumScape, First Solar, and ChargePoint experienced significant drops in October due to various factors including analyst downgrades, production delays, and political concerns. QuantumScape faced investor disappointment over a delayed production ramp-up, First Solar was impacted by a port strike and weak earnings, and ChargePoint suffered from analyst skepticism and fears surrounding President-elect Trump's stance on EVs. Despite these challenges, the article suggests maintaining a long-term investment perspective, especially for industry leaders like First Solar, while cautioning about the higher risk associated with QuantumScape and ChargePoint.

headline: Prudential Names Chappuis President and CEO of PGIM
summary: Prudential Financial, Inc. has appointed Jacques Chappuis as president and CEO of PGIM, its $1.4 trillion global investment management business, effective May 1, 2025. Chappuis succeeds David Hunt, under whose leadership PGIM's assets under management grew significantly from $619 billion to $1.4 trillion. Chappuis brings nearly 30 years of investment management experience, including a key role in the integration of Eaton Vance at Morgan Stanley Investment Management.

headline: DBS Reaffirms Their Hold Rating on Automatic Data Processing (ADP)
summary: DBS analyst Andy Yu CFA reaffirmed a Hold rating on Automatic Data Processing (ADP), setting a price target of $306.00. This comes as ADP reported strong quarterly revenue of $5.18 billion and a net profit of $1.01 billion for the quarter ending September 30. Other analysts also weighed in, with Morgan Stanley maintaining a Hold and Mizuho Securities reiterating a Buy.

headline: Hedge funds pile into banks, dump green energy post US election, Goldman Sachs says
summary: Hedge funds significantly increased their holdings in bank stocks and divested from renewable electricity producers following Donald Trump's U.S. presidential election win, according to a Goldman Sachs report. Financial stocks, particularly U.S. banks, are expected to benefit from a lighter regulatory environment and potential tax reform under the new administration. Conversely, utilities companies, especially independent power and renewable electricity producers, saw increased shorting by hedge funds.

headline: Dive Deposits: Carver Bank and the return of the thorn-in-the-side investor
summary: Investment fund Dream Chasers is once again pushing for two nominees to join the board of Black-owned Carver Federal Savings Bank, citing a significant drop in shareholder returns and financial losses. Carver has resisted Dream Chasers' attempts, citing regulatory history concerns and advocating for its own nominees and recent improvements in its financial trajectory under new leadership. The ongoing struggle highlights differing visions for the bank's future.

headline: VIG Vs. SCHD: Which Dividend ETF Is Right For Your Income Strategy in October 2025
summary: This article compares two popular dividend ETFs, VIG and SCHD, to help investors decide which is better for their income strategy in October 2025. It details their investment approaches, top holdings, sector exposures, expense ratios, performance, and investor suitability. The author leans towards SCHD due to its higher dividend yield, solid price performance, and impressive dividend growth metrics, especially given a shift towards a lower interest-rate environment.

headline: Wells Fargo touches all-time high as analyst hikes price target to new level
summary: Wells Fargo's stock reached an all-time high for the second consecutive day, driven by an analyst's price target increase. BofA analyst Ebrahim Poonwala raised his target to $84 per share, citing the bank's "superior growth" and "scale advantages." Wells Fargo shares were up fractionally on Tuesday afternoon at $72.57, marking a more than 47% gain year-to-date, outperforming many of its big bank peers.

headline: Crane NXT secures $200M credit and £300M term loans
summary: Crane NXT, Co. secured an additional $200 million in revolving commitments and £300 million in delayed draw term loan commitments, bringing its total revolving commitments to $700 million. These funds are primarily allocated for the acquisition of De La Rue's authentication division, reinforcing Crane NXT's strategic expansion plans. The company, trading near its 52-week high with EBITDA of $349.6 million, anticipates continued long-term growth despite projected dips in U.S. currency volume.

headline: iPower Secures $15M JPMorgan Credit Facility, Expandable to $40M Through 2027
summary: iPower (IPW) has renewed its secured revolving credit facility with JPMorgan Chase, extending the maturity to November 2027. The facility provides a $15.0 million revolving commitment, expandable to $40.0 million, with an interest rate based on SOFR plus 2.25% - 2.50%. This renewal is seen by the company as a validation of its strategy and will support growth initiatives, particularly in its SuperSuite supply chain business.

headline: KKR and Dragoneer Complete Acquisition of Instructure
summary: KKR and Dragoneer have completed their acquisition of Instructure, a leading learning ecosystem, for $23.60 per share in an all-cash transaction valued at approximately $4.8 billion. Instructure's common stock ceased trading on the New York Stock Exchange following the completion of the deal. This investment aims to support Instructure's product innovation and global growth, leveraging KKR's platform and Dragoneer's focus on high-quality businesses.

headline: Tencent sells Reddit shares worth $197.6 million
summary: Tencent Holdings Ltd sold Reddit, Inc. Class A common stock worth approximately $197.6 million between November 11 and November 13, 2024, through its subsidiary Tencent Cloud Europe B.V. Following these transactions, Tencent Cloud Europe B.V. now holds 9,238,594 shares of Reddit's Class A common stock, indicating a portfolio adjustment. This comes as Reddit showcases strong financial performance with a 68% increase in total revenue and positive GAAP Operating and Net Income, leading to multiple analyst price target increases.

headline: BlackRock launches S&P 500 top 20 ETF
summary: BlackRock has introduced a new iShares S&P 500 Top 20 UCITS ETF (SP20) on the London Stock Exchange, designed to track the top 20 largest constituents of the S&P 500 index. This launch provides European investors with targeted exposure to the largest US equities, as these top constituents have significantly outperformed the broader index. The ETF aims to address the need for precise exposure to US equities given the performance dispersion within the S&P 500.

headline: Coterra Energy to Buy Oil and Gas Assets for $3.95 billion
summary: Coterra Energy Inc. is set to acquire oil and gas assets in the Permian Basin for $3.95 billion, expanding its presence in New Mexico. The deal involves $2.95 billion in cash and $1 billion in stock from Franklin Mountain Energy and Avant Natural Resources. This acquisition aims to boost Coterra's future drilling sites and is expected to close in the first quarter of 2025.

headline: Massive New IPO Will Hoist Venture Global Into the Energy Elite
summary: Venture Global LNG is preparing for a massive IPO, potentially raising over $3 billion and valuing the company at more than $100 billion, according to JPMorgan. This move would place the US natural gas exporter among the top US energy companies, alongside firms like Occidental Petroleum and PG&E. The IPO is expected to occur as early as this week.

headline: Why This Fidelity Bond ETF Has Outperformed Over the Long Term
summary: The Fidelity Total Bond ETF (FBND) has consistently outperformed its benchmark, the Bloomberg U.S. Aggregate Bond Index, over the past one, three, and five years, signaling adept management in a changing interest rate environment. This actively managed ETF's success is attributed to its managers' strategic tilts in government debt, corporate bonds, and mortgage-backed securities, including favoring medium-maturity government debt, high-yield debt, and emerging-markets bonds. Despite anticipating no recession, the fund is currently reducing risk in corporate bonds and increasing Treasury holdings to maintain nimbleness for future opportunities.

headline: Public pressure mounts for Kiwisaver funds to invest ethically
summary: Public pressure is increasing on New Zealand's Kiwisaver funds to divest from companies with ties to Israel's military and settlements. A campaign is specifically targeting ASB due to its investments in Motorola Solutions, leading to a petition signed by thousands threatening to switch banks if ASB does not divest. Other major banks like BNZ, ANZ, and Westpac have also held investments in such companies, with some having recently divested due to similar pressures.

headline: JPM Ratings Upgraded by S&P Global: A Proof of Strength and Resilience
summary: S&P Global Ratings has upgraded JPMorgan's long- and short-term issuer credit ratings to A and A-1, respectively, with a stable long-term outlook. This upgrade reflects JPMorgan's strong fundamentals, diverse business model, market leadership, and robust capital position. The company's exceptional profitability, strong asset quality, leading deposit base, and strategic management were key factors in S&P Global's decision.

headline: FAT Brands Announces Refinancing of Twin Peaks Credit Facility
summary: FAT Brands Inc. announced the refinancing of Twin Peaks Credit Facility through the issuance of new notes totaling $416,711,000, with a weighted average interest rate of 9.5% per annum. This refinancing, a major step before the planned public listing of Twin Hospitality Group, aims to stabilize Twin Peaks' financial structure and drive growth. Jefferies LLC acted as the sole structuring agent and bookrunner for the transaction.

headline: Ovintiv acquires Montney assets from Paramount
summary: Ovintiv Inc. has announced the acquisition of Montney assets from Paramount Resources Ltd. for approximately US$2.377 billion, adding significant production and land in the Montney oil window. Concurrently, Ovintiv is selling its Uinta Basin assets for about US$2.0 billion. These combined transactions are projected to increase 2025 Non-GAAP Free Cash Flow by approximately US$300 million and enhance free cash flow per share by 20%, supporting the company's "durable returns strategy."

headline: J.P. Morgan Sticks to Their Buy Rating for Newmont Corporation CHESS (NEM)
summary: J.P. Morgan maintained a Buy rating on Newmont Corporation CHESS (NEM) with a price target of A$178.00. Another firm, TR | OpenAI – 4o, also reiterated a Buy rating with a A$152.00 price target. The company reported strong Q2 earnings with a quarterly revenue of A$5.32 billion and a net profit of A$2.06 billion, demonstrating significant growth from the previous year.

headline: Kkr sells OneStream shares for $191 million
summary: KKR, a private equity firm, sold 9,593,134 shares of OneStream, Inc. (NASDAQ:OS) Class A Common Stock for approximately $191.2 million, resulting in KKR entities no longer holding common stock in OneStream. This sale follows a public offering and comes amidst positive analyst ratings and strong financial indicators for OneStream, despite a recent stock dip and current unprofitability. Analysts, however, predict OneStream will become profitable this year, with strong revenue growth and gross profit margins.

headline: Will Active ETFs Outnumber Passive ETFs?
summary: The number of actively managed ETFs is rapidly growing, outpacing the launch of index-tracking funds, leading to speculation that they could soon outnumber passive ETFs in the US. This surge is driven by investor demand for ETF structures over mutual funds and facilitated by regulatory changes, though assets in active ETFs remain significantly lower than passive ones. The growth is particularly notable in systematic and derivatives-based strategies, as well as bond ETFs, rather than traditional stock-picking funds.

headline: Santander Asset Management en Chile designa dos nuevos directores luego de renuncias y completa cargos
summary: Santander Asset Management in Chile has appointed two new directors, Pedro Orellana Piñeiro and Patricia Pérez Pallacán, to fill vacancies created by resignations, including that of Jesús Martín Del Burgo. This move completes its board of directors. The new appointees bring extensive experience from within the Santander Group and are civil engineers by profession.

headline: BlackRock accused of contributing to climate and human rights abuses
summary: BlackRock, the world's largest asset manager, faces a complaint to the OECD alleging it contributes to climate and human rights abuses by investing in agribusinesses linked to deforestation. Friends of the Earth US and the Articulation of Indigenous Peoples of Brazil filed the complaint, stating BlackRock has increased investments in companies implicated in environmental devastation despite warnings. BlackRock refutes the claims, stating that the complaint is meritless and that the majority of holdings are in index funds chosen by clients.

headline: Wynn Al Marjan building structure 55pct complete: promoter
summary: Wynn Al Marjan Island, a casino resort in the UAE by Wynn Resorts Ltd, is on track for "topping off in December 2025" and a Q1 2027 opening. The structural concrete is 55 percent complete, with the main resort tower's concrete structure finished up to the 26th floor. The project, valued at US$5.1 billion, is expected to generate at least US$1.33 billion annually in gross gaming revenue.

headline: Putin’s pipeline: How the Kremlin outmaneuvered Western oil companies to wrest control of vast flows of Kazakhstan’s crude
source: International Consortium of Investigative Journalists - ICIJ
summary: This article details how the Kremlin gradually gained control over the Caspian Pipeline Consortium (CPC), outmaneuvering Western oil companies like Chevron, despite significant financial investments and environmental concerns. It highlights allegations of corruption, the use of strong-arm tactics by Russia, and how the pipeline became a geopolitical tool for Putin, especially amid the war in Ukraine. The investigation also reveals how Western companies and governments lobbied to keep the CPC pipeline exempt from sanctions due to its critical role in global oil supply.

headline: Dealmaker sees more urge to merge among smaller banks — yours may be among them
summary: A dealmaker predicts an increase in mergers among smaller banks with $10 billion or less in assets, starting in 2025. This trend is driven by the need for these banks to achieve scale to invest in new technologies like AI. Citizens Vice Chair Don McCree suggests that banks with lower price-to-tangible book value might be prime candidates for these tie-ups.

headline: First Foundation Bank taps new CEO to lead turnaround effort
summary: First Foundation Bank has appointed Tom Shafer, former TCF Bank CEO, as its new CEO to lead a turnaround effort. Shafer comes out of retirement to succeed the bank's longtime CEO and address challenges faced since the Silicon Valley Bank failure in early 2023. His experience with bank mergers and acquisitions is expected to be key in this role.

headline: J.P. Morgan Downgrades Alexandria Real Estate on Soft Life Sciences Leasing Demand
summary: J.P. Morgan downgraded Alexandria Real Estate Equities to neutral from overweight due to weak leasing demand in the life sciences sector and an oversupply of available properties in key markets. The bank also revised down its funds from operations per share forecasts for 2024, 2025, and 2026, citing slower core growth, lease expirations, and rising ground rent charges. Management is expected to address these challenges and outline a plan for FFO per share development at its upcoming investor day.

headline: Risk-Off Sentiment Puts Global Bonds Back in Focus
summary: Escalating global tensions are driving a risk-off sentiment, pushing investors towards safe-haven assets like bonds. The article suggests that international bond exposure is an ideal strategy to diversify portfolios, noting that geopolitical factors can significantly impact financial markets. It highlights the Vanguard Total World Bond ETF (BNDW) as a way to gain broad, diversified exposure to both U.S. and international investment-grade bonds.

headline: ETFs: No One is Stealing iShares' Crown | Morningstar UK
summary: iShares maintains its dominant position in the European ETF market, managing 43% of total ETF assets and leading in inflows for the first ten months of 2024. While iShares holds its crown, strong competition exists among other providers like State Street and Vanguard, who have seen significant organic growth due to strategic fee cuts and popular products. The overall trend shows European passive management growing significantly faster than active counterparts.

headline: Western Union Banks On First-Party Data To Woo Brands To Its New Media Network
summary: Western Union has launched a new media network, leveraging its first-party financial transaction data to connect advertisers with its diverse, multicultural customer base. The company aims to provide relevant value to its primarily migrant population, using data points like country of origin and transaction frequency for targeted advertising. This initiative, while a significant investment, is positioned as a differentiated offering in a crowded media landscape due to its unique audience access and commitment to privacy.

headline: With 65% ownership of the shares, NBT Bancorp Inc. (NASDAQ:NBTB) is heavily dominated by institutional owners
summary: Institutional investors own 65% of NBT Bancorp Inc. (NASDAQ:NBTB) shares, giving them significant influence over the company's stock price. While this institutional backing is generally seen as positive, the article highlights that no single shareholder has outright control, as the top 17 shareholders combined own 51%. Insiders also hold a notable stake of approximately US$65m, contributing to alignment with company performance, while the general public owns 33% of the shares.

headline: Vistra Corp: A Winning Bet on the Future of Renewable Energy
summary: Vistra Corp. has demonstrated exceptional growth and strategic repositioning in the energy sector, driven by its shift towards renewable sources and savvy acquisitions like Energy Harbor Corp. The company showcases strong financial performance with significant revenue growth and confidence in future earnings, despite navigating risks such as regulatory changes and high debt levels. Analysts maintain a "Buy" rating, reflecting optimism for its long-term potential in the energy transition.

headline: Orange Bank & Trust to open new Bronx location in 2025
summary: Orange Bank & Trust Co. will open a new full-service branch in the Bronx in 2025, marking its second location in the borough. The Middletown-based banking institution first established a presence in the Bronx in 2021.

headline: Coterra Energy (CTRA) Announces $1.5 Billion Senior Notes Offering
summary: Coterra Energy (CTRA) has announced a $1.5 billion public offering of senior notes, divided equally into $750 million of 5.40% Senior Notes due 2035 and $750 million of 5.90% Senior Notes due 2055. This strategic financial move, underwritten by J.P. Morgan Securities LLC, PNC Capital Markets LLC, and TD Securities (USA) LLC, aims to strengthen the company's financial position and support its long-term growth objectives. The offering is expected to close on December 17, 2024.

headline: Jim Cramer on EQT Corporation (EQT): ‘It May Be The Single Biggest Beneficiary of Trump’s Election’
summary: Jim Cramer highlighted EQT Corporation (EQT) as a strong performer, predicting it could be the biggest beneficiary of a Trump election due to its natural gas focus. He noted that stocks performing well in November often continue their momentum into December, a pattern he observed throughout his career, and emphasized the role of money flowing into the market at year-end. JPMorgan also raised EQT's price target, citing secular demand trends for natural gas, reinforcing a positive outlook for the company.

headline: Are managed futures ETFs nearing a Europe comeback?
summary: The article discusses the potential resurgence of managed futures ETFs in Europe, despite their past failures to gain traction. It highlights the diversification benefits of managed futures strategies, particularly their strong performance during bear markets and their ability to dampen portfolio volatility. The challenges for issuers looking to launch such products, including achieving sufficient size and market fragmentation, are also examined.

headline: Great Southern loan officers use gen AI to 'chat' with data
summary: Great Southern Bank is leveraging generative AI, specifically nCino's GenAI platform, to allow commercial loan officers to "chat" with data, including policy documents and loan records. This implementation is significantly improving efficiency and saving hours of time for the commercial lending department. The bank is also using the AI tool to generate narratives for commercial lending credit memos and is exploring its use for reviewing, sorting, and filing loan documents.

headline: Trump names Milwaukee’s FiServ CEO to run Social Security; advocate is wary
summary: President-elect Donald Trump has nominated Frank Bisignano, CEO of Milwaukee-based FiServ, to head the Social Security Administration. Bisignano, known for his investment banking background and high compensation, expressed his intent to "transform" the system, a prospect that worries advocate Nancy Altman of Social Security Works due to his lack of government and Social Security experience. Altman emphasizes that Social Security is insurance, not a savings account, and advocates for solutions that avoid benefit cuts, raising the retirement age, or privatization, preferring to raise income levels subject to payroll tax instead.

headline: Meet Morgan Stanley MAKER and D&I Champion Carolina Ureña
summary: This article profiles Carolina Ureña, a Morgan Stanley Executive Director and Head of Business Operations for the Private Banking Group Distribution Team, highlighting her journey as a first-generation Latina immigrant. It details her path from an underprivileged childhood to a successful career in finance, emphasizing her commitment to diversity, inclusion, and mentoring others, which earned her the Morgan Stanley MAKER distinction. The piece also covers her involvement in initiatives like Latino U College Access and the Women Leaders of PBG National Sales, showcasing her dedication to lifting up her community.

headline: Trump Names Fiserv CEO as His Social Security Administration Commissioner
summary: President-elect Donald Trump intends to nominate Fiserv CEO Frank Bisignano as the Social Security Administration Commissioner, signaling a focus on operational efficiency. Analysts view Bisignano's background as indicative of an administration-focused role rather than one pushing for broad policy changes or Social Security reform. His priorities are expected to center on improving service delivery and administrative challenges.

headline: Goldman Sachs quits global climate coalition for banks
summary: Goldman Sachs has announced its departure from the Net-Zero Banking Alliance (NZBA), a global climate coalition for banks. This decision makes it the most prominent member to leave the group, following pressure from some Republican politicians regarding potential anti-trust issues. Despite leaving, Goldman Sachs stated it would continue to focus on sustainability goals, including expanding its net-zero efforts and reporting on its progress, citing increasing regulatory requirements as a key driver.

headline: A Wall Street veteran, new WSFS CFO lays out strategy to grow market share
summary: The new CFO at WSFS Financial Corp., David Burg, a Wall Street veteran, believes the bank can significantly increase its market share in the Philadelphia area. He aims to achieve this by competing with the five larger banks currently dominating the region. The article details his strategy to grow WSFS's presence.

headline: NYC ad agencies Omnicom, Interpublic to form $30bn marketing powerhouse
summary: Omnicom is set to acquire Interpublic Group in a stock-for-stock deal, creating the world's largest advertising agency with combined annual revenue of almost $26bn and a market worth of over $30bn. The merger aims to accelerate innovation, leverage new technologies like AI, and achieve annual cost savings of $750m. The deal, which could face regulatory scrutiny, positions the combined entity, Omnicom, to better compete with tech giants and adapt to the evolving advertising landscape.

headline: GFO-X Announces ABN AMRO Clearing, IMC, Standard Chartered
summary: GFO-X has announced ABN AMRO Clearing, IMC, Standard Chartered Bank, and Virtu Financial as strategic partners in preparation for its Q1 2025 launch. GFO-X is the UK's first regulated and centrally cleared trading venue for digital asset derivatives, aiming to provide a secure and efficient trading environment for institutional investors. This collaboration underscores their commitment to advancing the institutional digital asset futures and options market and addressing the need for robust regulation and risk management in this evolving space.

headline: Omnicom to take over Interpublic Group; John Wren to continue as CEO and chairman
summary: Omnicom will acquire Interpublic Group in a stock-for-stock transaction, creating an advertising giant with combined annual revenue of almost $26 billion. John Wren will continue as Chairman and CEO of the combined company, which will retain the Omnicom name. The deal is expected to generate $750 million in annual cost synergies and offer expanded services across various marketing disciplines.

headline: Morgan Stanley Smith Barney fined $15M by SEC for inadequate supervision
summary: Morgan Stanley Smith Barney has been fined $15 million by the SEC for failing to adequately supervise four advisors who stole nearly $10 million from client accounts through unauthorized transfers. The firm consented to the penalty, including a cease-and-desist order and a requirement for a compliance consultant review, after having already reimbursed affected customers. While the SEC acknowledged the firm's cooperation and remedial efforts, the case highlights critical failures in safeguarding investor assets.

headline: Money managers circling in on $142B muni ETF space
summary: Money managers are increasingly targeting the $142 billion municipal-bond ETF market, with a record 27 launches this year by firms like PGIM and Rockefeller Asset Management. This growth is driven by investor demand for tax efficiency and transparency, despite challenges new products face in gaining adoption against established players like BlackRock and Vanguard. Experts anticipate continued expansion for muni ETFs due to their structural advantages and the current "good shape" of the municipal asset class.

headline: Eaton Vance’s Core Plus Bond ETF Passes $1 Billion in AUM
summary: The Eaton Vance Total Return Bond ETF (EVTR) has surpassed $1 billion in assets under management, a significant achievement since its conversion from a mutual fund in March 2024. This success highlights Eaton Vance's active management strategy for fixed income, blending investment-grade bonds with high-yield securities. The article also notes the earlier success of the Eaton Vance Floating-Rate ETF (EVLN), which similarly surpassed $1 billion in AUM after its conversion.

headline: MAA Announces Pricing of Senior Unsecured Notes Offering
summary: MAA's operating partnership, Mid-America Apartments, L.P. (MAALP), announced the pricing of a $350,000,000 offering of 4.950% senior unsecured notes due March 1, 2035. The offering, priced at 99.170% of the principal amount, is expected to close on December 18, 2024. Proceeds will primarily be used to repay borrowings under its unsecured commercial paper program, with remaining funds for general corporate purposes including debt repayment and property acquisition/development.

headline: Kodiak Gas Services Announces Public Offering of Common Stock by Selling Stockholder
summary: Kodiak Gas Services, Inc. announced an underwritten public offering of 5,500,000 shares of its common stock by a selling stockholder, an affiliate of EQT Infrastructure III and IV. Kodiak will not sell any shares or receive any proceeds from this offering. Goldman Sachs & Co. LLC and J.P. Morgan are acting as underwriters for the offering.

headline: Hobbs Brook Real Estate signs 125,500 s/f of new leases/renewals at 1301 Atwood Ave.
summary: Hobbs Brook Real Estate (HBRE) has secured 125,500 square feet in new leases and renewals at its Northwoods property located at 1301 Atwood Ave. in Johnston, RI. Key tenants include Dimeo Construction Company, Zebra Technologies Corp., and Dassault Systèmes. This leasing activity highlights the appeal of Northwoods' resilient operations, sustainable practices, and comprehensive amenities.

headline: Top 10 Fidelity Competitors and Alternatives (2025)
summary: This article examines the top 10 Fidelity competitors and alternatives, analyzing their services and offerings to help investors navigate their financial journey. It details companies like Charles Schwab, Vanguard Group, BlackRock, Interactive Brokers, and others, highlighting their unique strengths and how they compare to Fidelity's offerings in investment management, trading, and wealth management services. The article emphasizes how each competitor caters to different investor needs, from low-cost trading to personalized wealth management.

headline: Redwood Trust announces executive compensation packages
summary: Redwood Trust has disclosed its executive compensation packages for 2025, including equity awards and base salary adjustments for CEO Christopher J. Abate and other named executive officers. The compensation structure involves Deferred Stock Units, cash-settled Restricted Stock Units, and Performance Stock Units tied to the company's financial performance. This announcement follows recent developments including a downgrade by JPMorgan and mixed Q3 2024 earnings, as the company continues to focus on incentivizing leadership and strategic growth.

headline: UConn's endowment jettisons hedge funds for new breed of ETFs
summary: The University of Connecticut's endowment is shifting away from hedge funds to buffer ETFs to mitigate risk in its $634 million investment portfolio. The UConn Foundation sold nearly all its hedge fund exposure and acquired buffer ETFs, which offer a cheaper and more liquid way to lessen portfolio volatility. This move signifies a growing institutional embrace of these risk-dampening strategies, highlighting a trend towards lower fees and simplified hedging in endowment investing.

headline: AI bandwagon gathers pace in Europe with BlackRock ETF launches
summary: BlackRock has launched two new AI-focused ETFs in Europe, the iShares AI Infrastructure UCITS ETF (AINF) and the iShares AI Adopters & Applications UCITS ETF (AIAA), expanding choices for investors in a rapidly growing sector. While AI ETFs are gaining popularity, asset managers may face challenges in explaining their fit into investor portfolios, especially given their currently elevated valuations compared to broader market indices. Despite concerns, some dedicated AI ETFs in Europe have already attracted significant assets, indicating strong investor interest.

headline: The bond market is experiencing a "super week," with the 30-year Treasury Bond ETF rising more than 20% this year, and institutions state that volatility may continue after the New Year.
summary: The bond market experienced a "super week" with 30-year Treasury Bond ETFs seeing over 20% year-to-date returns due to declining yields and expectations of further rate cuts. This surge has impacted wealth management, leading to record-low Money Market Fund yields and a rapid increase in bank wealth management scales. Institutions anticipate continued volatility after the New Year despite current strong performance.

headline: Exclusive: Galicia Considers Stock Issuance and Calls for Mortgage Securitization
summary: Fabián Kon, CEO of Grupo Financiero Galicia, stated that Argentina needs a mortgage securitization market to drive credit growth, similar to models in the US. He also indicated that Galicia might consider a new stock issuance in 2026-2027 if Argentina’s economic rebound proves sustainable and credit demand continues to recover. Kon emphasized that mortgage securitization would free up bank lending capacity and inject life into the real estate market, while also noting the transformation of the Argentine financial system with banks reducing public bond exposure and increasing private sector lending.

headline: Who Owns Ross Stores?
summary: Ross Stores, operating as Ross Dress for Less, is a major American discount department store chain. The company is publicly traded on NASDAQ under the ticker ROST and also operates DD's DISCOUNTS. This article details its ownership history, current shareholder structure, and strategic business model focusing on off-price retail without an e-commerce platform.

headline: Thought ESG was hard to define? Try its antithesis
summary: This article discusses the complexities of defining and investing in "anti-ESG" portfolios, contrasting them with the already challenging ESG investment landscape. It highlights various approaches taken by anti-ESG ETFs and asset managers, such as screening companies based on executive opinions, political donations, or actively voting against stakeholder-focused proposals. The article also touches on the practical difficulties, including the limited number of Wall Street providers and the paradoxical inclusion of companies like Tesla in some anti-ESG portfolios.

headline: Benchstrength Closes $62M Early-Stage Venture Capital Fund
summary: Benchstrength, a NYC-based venture capital firm founded by former General Catalyst investors Ken Chenault Jr. and John Monagle, has announced the close of its first $62 million early-stage fund. The firm focuses on investing in pre-seed and seed stage technology companies across various sectors, particularly those with historically overlooked founders. The fund's investors include prominent institutions like the Ford Foundation, GCM Grosvenor, and Goldman Sachs Asset Management, as well as notable individual investors.

headline: 3 Regional Bank Stocks to Buy on Relaxed Regulations
summary: The article identifies three regional bank stocks—KeyCorp (KEY), Regions Financial (RF), and Huntington Bancshares (HBAN)—as attractive investment opportunities heading into 2025, primarily due to anticipated relaxed regulations (Basil III Endgame) and strong fundamentals. These banks have shown significant rallies in 2024, attracting bullish analyst ratings, high-yield dividends, and potential merger interest, suggesting a better outlook for the sector.

headline: Gold vs. Gold Equities: The Disconnect Won’t Last
summary: This article discusses the widening disconnect between gold prices and gold equities, particularly following the U.S. presidential election. Despite gold's resilience and potential for long-term upward momentum due to macroeconomic factors, gold equities have underperformed, reflecting poor sentiment and market dislocations. The author suggests that this disparity presents a compelling opportunity for investors as gold producers enjoy record margins.

headline: Raymond James bags $995M breakaway trio from Merrill
summary: Raymond James has recruited a three-advisor team from Merrill Lynch managing nearly $995 million in assets. The team, known as DKO Private Wealth Management, brings over 150 years of collective experience to Raymond James's employee channel in Cleveland, Ohio. This move is one of several significant recruitments by Raymond James from Merrill Lynch in 2024.

headline: India File: In 2025, stock markets face a glass half full
summary: Indian stock markets are expected to see more moderate returns in 2025, with a Reuters poll forecasting a modest 9% rise for the Sensex, lower than previous years, due to concerns over slowing consumer demand and flagging corporate earnings. Despite these challenges, India is projected to remain among the top five global markets for returns next year, attracting investors with its relative stability, though an elevated supply of equity from IPOs and block deals could pressure the markets. Analysts offer varied outlooks, with some cautioning on high valuations and earnings downgrades, while others foresee a "virtuous cycle" for India's equity markets.

headline: Vesta Announces Closing of US$545 Million Global Syndicated Sustainable Credit Facility Including US$200 Million Revolving Credit Facility
summary: Corporación Inmobiliaria Vesta has closed a US$545 million Global Syndicated Sustainable Credit Facility, which includes a US$345 million term loan and a US$200 million Revolving Credit Facility. This financing provides Vesta with strategic liquidity reserves at a competitive cost to support its Route 2030 growth plan and prudent financial management. The credit facility also incorporates a sustainability pricing adjustment tied to Vesta's compliance with its annual KPI target for certified gross leasable area.

headline: Exclusive: Food distributor HF Foods Group names permanent CEO
summary: HF Foods Group (Nasdaq: HFFG) has named Felix Lin as its permanent CEO, effective January 1, bringing stability and a focus on growth through acquisitions. This appointment follows SEC fraud charges against the former CEO and CFO, and Lin plans to grow the business organically and through M&A targeting ethnic cuisine distributors. The company reported nearly $900 million in revenue for the nine months ending September 30.

headline: BlackRock Acquires $6,5 Million Municipal Bond Through Blockchain
summary: BlackRock has acquired a $6.5 million municipal bond issued and settled via blockchain, marking a significant step in the integration of blockchain technology into traditional finance. This transaction, facilitated by JPMorgan Chase & Co.’s private blockchain platform, highlights the potential for reduced costs and increased efficiency in the municipal bond market. The investment was made through BlackRock's iShares Short Maturity Municipal Bond Active ETF (MEAR), signaling the asset manager's continued commitment to disruptive technologies.

headline: JBG Smith Offloads Another D.C. Office Building For $110M
summary: JBG Smith has sold a 375K SF office building at 2101 L St. NW in Washington, D.C., to BG Ventures for $110M. This sale is part of JBG Smith's ongoing strategy to reduce its holdings in the District, following other recent dispositions and foreclosures. BG Ventures sees this as a good opportunity to acquire a well-located building at a favorable price, despite the property being 75% leased.

headline: Warren warns OCC, Fed of ‘malfeasance’ on Capital One-Discover
summary: Senator Elizabeth Warren has accused the Federal Reserve and the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency of "regulatory malfeasance" for not updating bank merger guidelines to evaluate the proposed Capital One-Discover merger. She argues that using outdated guidelines would lead to an inappropriate approval of the deal, especially since other agencies like the FDIC and Justice Department have already revised theirs. Warren emphasized that given Capital One's history of regulatory missteps and the updated guidelines, the merger should be denied.

headline: Why Is Schlumberger Limited (SLB) One of the Top Oil and Gas Stocks To Invest In According to Hedge Funds?
summary: Schlumberger Limited (SLB) is highlighted as a top oil and gas stock to invest in, according to hedge funds, ranking 4th among energy stocks specializing in oil and gas. The article discusses global oil demand trends, a generally bleak outlook for oil prices in the near future, and the oil and gas industry's significant contributions to the global economy and shareholder returns despite these challenges. Schlumberger's strong Q3 2024 performance, including revenue growth, expanded EBITDA margins, and substantial free cash flow, along with its strategic investments in technology and AI, underpin its favorable position.

headline: Wells Fargo Says It’s Quitting Climate-Banking Group
summary: Wells Fargo & Co. announced its departure from the Net-Zero Banking Alliance, following Goldman Sachs Group Inc., amid increasing pressure from Republican lawmakers regarding financial institutions' climate initiatives. This move is seen as a continuation of Wall Street's trend of breaking away from such climate groups, with Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton linking Wells Fargo's decision to reviews of its potential boycott of energy companies. Despite warnings from GOP-led committees about a "climate cartel," the NZBA states that while five banks have left since 2021, over 100 have joined.

headline: MetLife expands asset management arm with up to $1.2 bln deal for PineBridge
summary: MetLife's asset management arm has agreed to acquire PineBridge Investments from Hong Kong billionaire Richard Li's Pacific Century Group for up to $1.2 billion. This acquisition aims to expand MetLife's asset management capabilities and is expected to increase its assets under management beyond $700 billion. The deal involves an $800 million upfront cash payment and additional payments based on financial targets.

headline: Applovin corp CLO Victoria Valenzuela sells $5m in stock
summary: Victoria Valenzuela, Chief Legal Officer of AppLovin Corp, sold 15,971 shares of her company's Class A common stock for approximately $5 million on December 19, 2024. This transaction comes as AppLovin's stock has surged over 727% in the past year, reflecting strong financial health and growth prospects, with analysts raising price targets due to robust revenue performance and strategic financial restructuring.

headline: India's "stock frenzy"? Funds are pouring into the Indian stock market frantically.
summary: The Indian stock market is experiencing a significant boom, drawing in substantial capital from both retail and institutional investors, reminiscent of the 1990s US stock market. This surge is driven by strong domestic investment, policy changes, and the emergence of discount brokers, leading to impressive market performance despite high valuations and recent foreign capital outflows. However, regulators are concerned about potential bubbles and market crashes as retail investors increasingly perceive stocks as a "risk-free investment."

headline: 1 Vanguard Index Fund Could Turn $375 Per Month Into a $569,400 Portfolio That Pays $17,200 in Annual Dividend Income
summary: This article highlights how consistent small investments in the Vanguard High Dividend Yield ETF (VYM) can lead to a substantial retirement portfolio. Investing $375 monthly could result in a nearly $570,000 portfolio yielding over $17,000 in annual dividend income over 30 years. The ETF's low expense ratio, lower volatility compared to the S&P 500, and historical performance are key attractive features for risk-averse investors.

headline: Ascentage Pharma to Present at 43rd Annual J.P. Morgan Healthcare Conference
summary: Ascentage Pharma announced that its Chairman and CEO, Dr. Dajun Yang, will present at the 43rd Annual J.P. Morgan Healthcare Conference on January 16, 2025. He will discuss the company's progress and global innovation strategy. The conference is a significant event for the global pharmaceutical industry and investment community, taking place in San Francisco, CA.

headline: AAPG IPO News - China-based cancer biotech Ascentage Pharma files for a $100 million US IPO
summary: Ascentage Pharma, a China-based cancer biotech, has filed for a $100 million US IPO. The company, already listed in Hong Kong, is developing small molecule inhibitors for cancer and recorded $124 million in sales for the 12 months ended June 30, 2024. Its lead drug, olverembatinib, is approved in China, and a second candidate, lisaftoclax, is awaiting NDA approval in China.

headline: Deals & Recruiting Roundup: SEIA, Raymond James, Osaic, Citi, And More
summary: This Deals & Recruiting Roundup highlights significant movements in the wealth management industry including M&A activities by Focus and Savant, advisor recruitments by Raymond James and Bison Wealth, and strategic partnerships like Osaic with HarborOne. It also features key leadership appointments at Cetera, Ameriprise, WCG, and Citi, alongside J.P. Morgan Wealth Management topping J.D. Power rankings and a profile of Cameron Stagg of SEIA as Recruiter of the Month. Larry Roth's "Larry's Take" emphasizes the critical role of human talent and strong executive teams in the success and retention within wealth management firms.

headline: News | Rexford aids US industrial rebound with one of 2024's priciest Los Angeles deals
summary: Rexford Industrial Realty acquired a 300,000-square-foot warehouse in Los Angeles for $137.2 million, marking one of the region's most expensive industrial deals in 2024. This acquisition, coupled with increased import activity at Southern California ports and a rebound in U.S. consumer spending, signals a potential rebound in the industrial market despite recent softening. REITs like Rexford and EQT Exeter are increasingly driving industrial transactions, taking advantage of lower borrowing and purchase costs.

headline: KeyCorp appoints J.P. Morgan vet as new head of Key Family Wealth
summary: KeyCorp has appointed Robert Weiss, a J.P. Morgan veteran, as the new head of its Key Family Wealth business. Weiss succeeds Gary Poth and will report to Key Wealth president Joe Skarda. This appointment comes during a period of significant growth for Key's wealth management business, which has been a strong contributor to the company's fee income.

headline: JPMorgan Chase reportedly joins the 5-days-a-week RTO wave
summary: J.P. Morgan Chase & Co. is reportedly joining Goldman Sachs in requiring employees to work from the office five days a week, hinting at a potential new norm for financial services firms. CEO Jamie Dimon has been a strong proponent of in-person work, stating that "In general, there's nothing like face-to-face." This move comes despite warnings from some experts about potential employee dissatisfaction and signaling employer mistrust regarding all-or-nothing work arrangements.

headline: WilmerHale Advises Revvity in $1.5B Financing
summary: WilmerHale represented Revvity, Inc. in connection with its new $1.5 billion syndicated revolving credit facility. The facility involves Bank of America, JPMorgan, Goldman Sachs, PNC Bank, and Wells Fargo Bank, acting in various agent and arranger roles. The unsecured, multi-currency credit facility has a five-year maturity and closed on January 7, 2025.

headline: BankOnBuffalo parent company will acquire Pa. bank in $214M deal
summary: CNB Bank, the parent company of BankOnBuffalo, announced its first acquisition since 2020, agreeing to buy Essa Bank in an all-stock deal valued at $214 million. This move marks a significant expansion for CNB Bank within the banking sector.

headline: Blackstone sells preferred equity stake in CityCenter to Realty Income
summary: Blackstone Inc. is selling a preferred equity stake in the CityCenter Las Vegas complex to Realty Income Corp. for $800 million, while Blackstone Real Estate will retain 100% common equity ownership. This investment is expected to provide Realty Income with an initial unlevered return rate of 7.4% and increases its 2025 investment volume outlook to over $6.0 billion. The transaction builds on a strategic relationship between the two companies, with the property continuing to be operated by MGM Resorts International under an existing triple net lease.

headline: Western Asset EMD team exits for PPM America
summary: Western Asset Management's (WAM) emerging markets debt team, comprising four investment professionals, has departed to join PPM America, a subsidiary of Jackson Financial. The team includes Mark Hughes, Kevin Ritter, Matthew Graves, and Kevin Zhang, who have worked together since 2008. They express excitement about joining PPM America due to its team-based culture and focus on fundamental research.

headline: AI Enables Major Healthcare Advances At JP Morgan Event
summary: The JP Morgan Healthcare Conference is increasingly focusing on AI's transformative role in medicine. Nvidia is a key player, powering digital healthcare devices and collaborating with institutions like Mayo Clinic and IQVIA to drive AI-driven diagnostics and genomic insights. The article posits that AI will revolutionize healthcare, particularly in eradicating diseases like cancer, by leveraging vast clinical data to develop personalized medicine.

headline: JPMorganChase Announces New Responsibilities for Senior Leaders
summary: JPMorgan Chase announced a leadership reshuffle as Daniel Pinto, President and COO, plans to retire by the end of 2026. Jennifer Piepszak will become the new Chief Operating Officer immediately, and Doug Petno and John Simmons will take on new leadership roles within the Commercial & Investment Bank and Global Banking, respectively. These changes aim to build on the firm's leadership across global financial services.

headline: Crypto ETFs have big innovation opportunity in 2025, but demand may be weak
summary: Crypto ETFs are expected to see innovation in 2025 with new funds, but demand for these new offerings may not match the success of the first bitcoin ETFs. While applications for funds tracking Solana, XRP, and litecoin have been submitted, JPMorgan analysts project significantly lower asset inflows compared to bitcoin ETFs. Despite potential regulatory improvements, experts suggest tempering expectations for growth unless crypto ETFs are integrated into Wall Street's model portfolios.

headline: The Case for Active Fixed Income in 2025
summary: This article argues for the adoption of active fixed income strategies over passive ones in 2025, highlighting their advantages in adapting to changing interest rate environments and managing diverse bond types. It specifically mentions core-plus bond strategies and international bond opportunities, using JPMorgan ETFs (JCPB and JPIB) as examples. The article also notes how active management can assist with tax efficiency through municipal bonds.

headline: Flowco Holdings Inc. Announces Pricing of Initial Public Offering
summary: Flowco Holdings Inc. announced the pricing of its initial public offering of 17,800,000 shares of Class A common stock at $24.00 per share, with trading expected to begin on the New York Stock Exchange under "FLOC" on January 16, 2025. The company will use the net proceeds to redeem equity interests and repay existing debt. J.P. Morgan, Jefferies, Piper Sandler, and Evercore ISI are leading the offering.
